modules.description: This module offers utilities for defining and parsing structured configuration parameters from command-line arguments or static defaults, supporting atomic types like booleans and integers alongside complex forms such as lists, arrays, tuples, and enumerations. It enables declarative parameter specification with optional values, deprecation metadata, and separator-driven structured parsing, while providing combinators to compose converters for nested data shapes. Typical applications include building CLI interfaces with typed argument validation, generating manpage documentation from parameter definitions, and handling configuration files with fallback defaults or environment variable overrides.

This module combines low-level program analysis with structured configuration handling, enabling precise extraction and manipulation of function calls in BAP IR while supporting rich, typed parameter definitions for tool customization. It provides core data types for representing call sites, resolved callees, and variable bindings, alongside configuration descriptors for atomic and composite values such as enums, lists, and tuples. Operations include call target resolution, argument mapping, attribute transfer, and structured parsing of command-line or file-based configurations with fallbacks and validation. You can use it to rewrite call sites based on static analysis, propagate function attributes across call chains, or define type-safe CLI interfaces with automatic documentation and deprecation handling.
